arts.ttl: Exeter City 2 Mansfield Town 0 - Grecians cruise to another victory and climb the table - Devon Live
arts.sum: Caleb Watts then saw one effort cleared off the line, another rattle the crossbar, as City created plenty of chances to put the game beyond doubt. Angus MacDonald though powered home a header from a corner minutes into the second half to give the Grecians that 2-0 lead they had deserved and in complete control.

arts.ttl: Exeter City keep another clean sheet as Grecians return to form
arts.sum: Exeter City goalkeeper Joe Whitworth kept a third clean sheet in a row as with the Grecians having a settled backline has corresponded with a return to form. Whitworth added: “The consistency helps and get clean sheets and good results, and it is good to play in front of these three lads and hope to keep it going for the rest of the season.

arts.ttl: Exeter pull clear of drop zone with win over struggling Mansfield
arts.sum: Demetri Mitchell and Angus MacDonald scored early in each half.

arts.ttl: Exeter City wary of Mansfield Town threat but looking to extend unbeaten run
arts.sum: “They have got Will Evans, who is a fantastic striker, so we know the threat that they pose, but we also know that we are playing extremely well and we have to continue that form and those results in the short-term and obviously right on until the end of the season.” Despite that poor run, which has seen the Stags go from promotion contenders to relegation battlers, manager Gary Caldwell is wary of the threat they pose, pointing to their early season form as evidence of how good they can be.

arts.ttl: Exeter City building momentum with Grecians unbeaten in three
arts.sum: “We are building some momentum and hope for another good result Tuesday and then to look up rather than down. The first of those is on Tuesday night at home to Mansfield Town, and with the Stags on a 13-game winless run, it is a game that City will be hoping to win.

arts.ttl: Exeter City Women up to third after narrow win at Oxford United
arts.sum: Oxford’s best chance came in the 37th minute, as Barratt’s cross into the six-yard box left Bond stranded, but Toogood was in the right place to clear over the bar just in time. Oxford came out with attacking intent after the break, sending an early effort over before Bond was called into action, pushing away Barratt’s near-post strike.

arts.ttl: Exeter City hopeful they have found a new settled backline
arts.sum: “It’s been a frustrating few weeks, obviously getting sent off isn’t an ideal way to make your debut, but I felt like I got back out there and I did what I know I can do and kept the clean sheet,” he said. All three played together for the first time in Tuesday’s goalless draw at Reading and suggested that after a season of chopping and changing to his backline, Caldwell may have found a formula that works – and one he can rely on for the remaining 14 games of the League One season.

arts.ttl: Exeter City 2 Shrewsbury Town 0 - Grecians back to winning ways and move towards safety - Devon Live
arts.sum: Josh Magennis squandered a golden chance to give the Grecians the lead when his penalty was brilliantly saved by Jamal Blackman. Demetri Mitchell on the volley doubled the lead early in the second half as he struck a sweetly timed effort from just inside the box.

arts.ttl: Exeter City earn huge three points in comfortable Shrewsbury Town victory
arts.sum: Exeter City picked up a huge three points as they comfortably beat struggling Shrewsbury Town to ease their relegation fears. Demetri Mitchell on the volley doubled the lead early in the second half as he struck a sweetly timed effort from just inside the box.

arts.ttl: Preview: Exeter City vs. Mansfield Town - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Tuesday's League One clash between Exeter City and Mansfield Town, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.
